1.q_string: Which of the following options is correctly depicting the formula of power?

If two bulbs, one of 200 W and the other of 100 W are connected in series with a 100 V battery, then which bulb will have more brightness:
q_option: 100 W bulb will have more brightness
200 W bulb will have more brightness

1.q_string: The process of electroplating, using the phenomenon of electrolysis, is primarily based on:

q_option: Measure the electric current in a circuit
Measure the potential difference across a resistance
Measure the power supplied in the circuit

1.q_string: Potential gradient is defined as:
q_option: Fall of potential per unit length of the wire
Fall of potential per unit area of the wire
Fall of potential between two ends of the wire
Potential at any one end of the wire

1.q_string: An equilateral triangle is made of three wires of equal resistances 4 Ω. Find the equivalent resistance across any one side.
If two unequal resistors connected in parallel then:
q_option: The voltage is different in both resistor
The current is same in both resistor
The voltage is large in one of the smaller resistor
The current is large in smaller resistor

1. The shorter length of the potentiometer wire is preferred.

2. Copper wire is used in potentiometers.

3. The electric field inside the potentiometer is variable.

4. If the length of the wire is halved, the position of zero deflection in a potentiometer occurs at a longer length.
